s.text: 6. "Long-struggling Amtrak, which thought it had finally found a true winner in the high-speed Acela train, announced this week that the Acela won't be launched until next spring at the earliest because the vibration of the trains is causing 'excessive wheel wear.'
3. "Nobel Prize-winning economist Milton Friedman told a German business daily that the U.S. stock market was endangering the U.S. economy, because 'a strong market crash' was increasingly likely .
2. "Juniper Networks, which makes routers for the infrastructure of the Internet, went public in late June and, at its peak, was up 700 percent in two months .
4. "Malaysia finally lifted the capital controls it imposed in the wake of the drastic devaluation of its currency and the collapse of its economy last summer.
